texts.name: Pseudo-Turpin Chronicle
texts.shelfmark: London, British Library MS Arundel 220, ff.284r-298v
texts.overview: A rather miscellaneous manuscript which includes Latin texts, such as an abridgement of Geoffrey of Monmouth's Historia regum Brittanie, and French texts, such as Walter de Bibbesworth's Tretiz de langage and some French verse.

texts.name: Pseudo-Turpin Chronicle
texts.shelfmark: Copenhagen, Arnamagnæan Institute AM 180 c fol
texts.overview: Contains only material from Karlamagnus saga

texts.name: Pseudo-Turpin Chronicle
texts.shelfmark: Copenhagen, Arnamagnæan Institute AM 180 a fol
texts.overview: AM 180 a fol. contains only Charlemagne material, but this manuscript and AM 180 b fol. appear to have originally formed part of the same codex. AM 180 b fol features Knytlinga, Konrads, Vitus and Laurentius sagas, as well as Dunstanus, Katrinar and Baerings saga.

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 8a

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 7
texts.overview: This manuscript also contains material relating to Christ's passion and a text of the Welsh Perceval analogue, Peredur.

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 10

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 8b

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Cwrtmawr 2

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 9, ff. 29r-33v, 36r-36v, 27r-27v, 1r-9v

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Aberystwyth, National Library of Wales MS Peniarth 5 (The White Book of Rhydderch, part 1), ff. 66r-78v
texts.overview: This manuscript and Peniarth 4 originally formed a single codex and were separated at an early point. The larger compilation also includes the Four Branches of the Mabinogi, Culhwch and Olwen, The Dream of Macsen Wledig, Lludd and Llefelys, Peredur and Owain and Geraint and Enid.

texts.name: Chronicl Turpin
texts.shelfmark: Oxford, Jesus College, MS 111 (The Red Book of Hergest)
texts.overview: The manuscript contains chronicles, romances and court poetry, including a Welsh version of Geoffrey of Monmouth’s Historia Regum Brittaniae, Owain, Gereint, the Four Branches of the Mabinogi, the Welsh translation of Boeve de Haumtone (Bevis of Hampton) and other Welsh translations of Matter of France material.

texts.name: Turpines Story
texts.shelfmark: San Marino, CA, Huntington Library MS HM 28561, ff. 326-337
texts.overview: Turpines Story is the final item in the codex, which is mostly composed of Trevsian material, in particular his translation of the Polychronicon. There is also Latin material on the kings of England. It is possible that Turpines Story and this Latin material were added to the codex at a slightly later stage.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: London, British Library MS Egerton 1781, ff. 20r–36v
texts.overview: The other contents of the mansucript are quite mixed, comprising religious works, place-name lore and secular narratives. There are a number of other translated texts.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: Chatsworth, Book of Lismore [Leabhar Mhic Cárthaigh Riabhaigh], ff. 54r-66v
texts.overview: A large miscellaneous manuscript featuring narratives from the Irish tradition, saints lives and Irish translations of the Book of Marco Polo and The History of the Lombards.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: Dublin, University College, MS A 9, ff. 1r-16v
texts.overview: Most texts in this manuscript are religious in nature.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: Dublin, Trinity College, MS 1304
texts.overview: The folios of material from the Pseudo-Turpin translation have been added to other material, including a fragmentary text of the Irish translation of Fierabras.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: Dublin, Kings Inns Library, MS 10, ff. 1r-16r
texts.overview: The other manuscript contents are religious works, some of them translated from Latin. A copy of the Irish translation of Fierabras precedes the text of the Pseudo-Turpin translation.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: London, British Library MS Egerton 92, section C, ff. 15ra–16rb [Book of Fermoy fragment]
texts.overview: The manuscript is composed of several sections. The other contents of this section mostly consist of exempla and anecdotes relating to Irish saints. Accounts of St Cranat of Fermoy, an account of the topography of Fermoy, and an account of the descent of Munster kings reflect the manuscript’s geographical provenance.

texts.name: Gabhaltais Shearluis Mhóir
texts.shelfmark: Edinburgh, National Library of Scotland, Advocates MS 72.1.6, ff. 12r-13r
texts.overview: This bifolium was formerly the cover of the manuscript. Apart from the portion of the Pseudo-Turpin translation, it contains some short monastic anecdotes.
